result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey L Boone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey L Boone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
3:10 p.m. Defendant Corey L Boone in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CF304, 14TR2955, 15CF141, and 14TR2956.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  15CF141 Count 1, 14CF304 Ct 1 & 2
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF141 Count 1: No Contest
14CF304 Ct 1: No Contest
14CF304 Ct 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF304 Ct 1 & 2 and 15CF141 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
15CF141 ct 2 is Dismissed Read In.
14CF304 Ct 3 is DRI.
14TR2955 is DRI.
14TR2956 is DRI.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes apologetic statements.
Defendant's mother makes supportive statements to the Court.
Court has reviewed the correspondence that was received today.

BY THE COURT:******PROBATION****
15CF304 Ct 1: I/S Sentence: 2yrs 6 mo Incarceration and 2 years Extended Supervision - stayed
36 mo Probation
Conditions:
180 days jail, with 90 days credit, balance to be served with Huber Privileges and be served on electronic monitor during the time at the Riverside Home.
Pay Restitution is $508.26.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol during your term of probation.  
Comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs and surcharges.

15CF304 Ct 2: OWI 2nd (.138%) $500 + costs = $1,568.00
23 days jail, concurrent with Count 1, same conditions.
14 mo revocation of driver's license
14 mo IID
DOT/AODA Safety plan

15CF141 Ct 1: OAR: $100 fine + costs = $379.00

Any bond on file to be applied to restitution first, then to fines & costs.
4:20 p.m. Matter rescheduled - not enough time today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Corey L Boone in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-304, 15CF-141, 14TR-2955 and 14TR-2956.

11:12 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court.
15CF-141 was put on today for preliminary waiver, and plea., but Atty Barkley is moving to withdraw.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court, received communication from his client that he no longer wishes to represent him. 
Atty Barkley submitted to the Court an order of withdrawal.

Court reviews the file. 

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant cannot afford a paid attorney and doesn't feel that he has been adequately represented.
Defendant retained Atty Barkley.

Defendant states he can go to the public defender's office, has not gone there yet.

BY THE COURT:
Court directs that Atty Barkley be permitted to withdraw and Court will sign the order today.
Court directs Defendant to go to the public defender's office.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Corey L Boone in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:03 AM Court calls case.
Atty Barkley received a copy of the complaint, waives reading, enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Atty Barkley waives time for preliminary hearing.

State addresses bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
